fields.title: evaluating multiple integrals: polar coordinates
fields.pointers:
* This trick can be generalized to three dimensions:
**  [spherical coordinates](eval_multi_int_spherical_coordinates)
**  [cylindrical coordinates](eval_multi_int_cylindrical_coordinates)
* This trick is an instance of the more general notion of  [change of variables](eval_multi_int_change_of_variables) .
fields.summary: A common trick for computing double integrals is to transform them into a polar coordinate representation. Canonical examples include integrating a Gaussian and computing moments of inertia.
